description: Throughout the ancient Americas, the animal world was closely linked to social hierarchies and obligations. In this worldview, and in connection with the onset of the rainy season, frogs like the one depicted here were seen as summoners of water. This in turn was connected to the idea of a ruler’s ultimate responsibility to the community being to ensure the continuity of the agricultural cycle.
artist_info:
Coclé
Venado Beach
Coclé province, Panama
title: Filagree Pendant in the Form of a Frog or Toad
